reviewText: Product received for free\n\nInsincere feels incomplete, honestly. The game environment is barren and grainy, the cutscenes are skippy, and the camera moves choppily all around. If this were an N64 game, it'd seem just fine for a story-focused sci-fi FPS which reminded me of Metroid. But by today's standards, it's in a beta version at best. I understand the developers put a lot of work into this and I've normally got a soft spot for projects of passion made by a small team, but this just feels unfinished.

reviewText:
Insincere is a nice little indie-fps. The player wakes up in a strange facility with no memories and is searching for a way out. The whole game has little outdated graphics but good voice-acting and music. The story is good and there are a few ingame-cinematics. Gameplay is fluid and the shooting is fun. Controls are ok, but maybe you need to change keybindings in an ini file. All in all, i like it very much and had a lot of fun in my playthough. Playtime is arounf 2 hours. For that cheap price, i recommend it.


Pros:

Fun to play
Story
Voice-acting
Music
Price


Cons:

Outdated graphics
No options-menu


Here a few minutes of ingame-footage:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GZDhAR3DxLc

reviewText:
If you were in diapers when Doom came out you probably wont like this one.

All the Bad Reviews appear to be from people comparing a 3 dollar indi game made by one dude to the latest COD game made with a 50million dollar budget and a team of 50+.

This is a solid FPS shooter with old school feel.

Good stuff.
